answerText: The Black Riders and Other Lines[10] Stephen Crane, the author of The Black Riders, wrote this short story about Scratchy Wilson's inability to fight Jack Potter in the title town because Jack got married.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 13 - Finals 1 | 18 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This collection includes a poem about "a creature, naked, bestial, / who, squatting upon the ground, / Held his heart in his hands, / And ate of it. For 10 points each: [10] Name this collection of poems which begins with a description of the title figures that "came from the sea" with "clang and clang" and "clash and clash."
